001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.listeners;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.log.LogUi;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.enums.WebElementAction;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.logging.ExceptionLogging;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebElementInspector;
007import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
008import java.lang.reflect.Method;
009import java.util.Arrays;
010import java.util.Optional;
011import org.openqa.selenium.WebElement;
012import org.openqa.selenium.support.events.WebDriverListener;
013
014/**
015 * Custom WebDriver event listener for logging and exception handling.
016 *
017 * <p>This class implements {@link WebDriverListener} to provide logging before and after element interactions
018 * and manage exception handling for WebDriver actions.
019 *
020 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
021 */
022public class WebDriverEventListener implements WebDriverListener {
023
024   /**
025    * Logs an informational message before an element is clicked.
026    *
027    * @param element The WebElement that is about to be clicked.
028    */
029   @Override
030   public void beforeClick(final WebElement element) {
031      LogUi.extended("Element: '{}' is about to get clicked", element.toString());
032   }
033
034   /**
035    * Logs an informational message after an element is clicked.
036    *
037    * @param element The WebElement that was clicked.
038    */
039   @Override
040   public void afterClick(final WebElement element) {
041      LogUi.extended("Element: '{}' was clicked", element.toString());
042   }
043
044   /**
045    * Handles errors occurring during WebDriver method executions.
046    *
047    * <p>This method logs the exception details and determines if the exception should be handled by
048    * the framework or logged as unhandled.
049    *
050    * @param target The object on which the method was invoked.
051    * @param method The method that caused the exception.
052    * @param args   The arguments passed to the method.
053    * @param e      The invocation target exception.
054    */
055   @Override
056   public void onError(final Object target, final Method method, final Object[] args,
057                       final InvocationTargetException e) {
058      Throwable cause = e.getCause();
059
060      LogUi.extended("Exception in method {}: {}", method.getName(), cause.getMessage());
061      SmartWebElementInspector.Result result = SmartWebElementInspector.inspectStackTrace(cause);
062
063      if (result.comingFromWait()) {
064         return;
065      }
066
067      if (result.foundAnnotatedMethod()) {
068         if (result.foundHandleException()) {
069            LogUi.error("Exception was not handled");
070         } else {
071            LogUi.info("Framework will try to handle the exception");
072         }
073      } else {
074         LogUi.info("No implementation in framework for exception handling in this method");
075      }
076      exceptionLogging(target, method, args, e, cause);
077
078   }
079
080   /**
081    * Logs and handles exceptions based on predefined criteria.
082    *
083    * @param target The object on which the method was invoked.
084    * @param method The method that caused the exception.
085    * @param args   The arguments passed to the method.
086    * @param e      The invocation target exception.
087    * @param cause  The root cause of the exception.
088    */
089   private static void exceptionLogging(final Object target, final Method method, final Object[] args,
090                                        final InvocationTargetException e, final Throwable cause) {
091      Optional<ExceptionLogging> matched = Arrays.stream(ExceptionLogging.values())
092            .filter(log -> matchesLogCriteria(log, target, method, args, cause)).findFirst();
093
094      matched.ifPresent(exceptionLogging -> {
095         WebElementAction action = exceptionLogging.getAction();
096         exceptionLogging.getExceptionLoggingMap().get(cause.getClass()).accept(target, action, args, e);
097      });
098   }
099
100   /**
101    * Checks whether an exception matches the criteria for logging and handling.
102    *
103    * @param log    The exception logging configuration.
104    * @param target The object on which the method was invoked.
105    * @param method The method that caused the exception.
106    * @param args   The arguments passed to the method.
107    * @param cause  The root cause of the exception.
108    * @return True if the exception matches the criteria, false otherwise.
109    */
110   private static boolean matchesLogCriteria(final ExceptionLogging log, final Object target, final Method method,
111                                             final Object[] args, final Throwable cause) {
112      return isTargetValid(log, target)
113            && isMethodValid(log, method)
114            && isCauseValid(log, cause)
115            && areArgumentsCompatible(method, args);
116   }
117
118   private static boolean isTargetValid(ExceptionLogging log, Object target) {
119      return log.getTargetClass().isAssignableFrom(target.getClass());
120   }
121
122   private static boolean isMethodValid(ExceptionLogging log, Method method) {
123      return log.getAction().getMethodName().equals(method.getName());
124   }
125
126   private static boolean isCauseValid(ExceptionLogging log, Throwable cause) {
127      return log.getExceptionLoggingMap().containsKey(cause.getClass());
128   }
129
130   private static boolean areArgumentsCompatible(Method method, Object[] args) {
131      Class<?>[] paramTypes = method.getParameterTypes();
132      Class<?>[] argTypes = Arrays.stream(args)
133            .map(arg -> arg == null ? null : arg.getClass())
134            .toArray(Class<?>[]::new);
135
136      if (paramTypes.length != argTypes.length) {
137         return false;
138      }
139
140      for (int i = 0; i < paramTypes.length; i++) {
141         if (!isArgumentAssignable(paramTypes[i], argTypes[i])) {
142            return false;
143         }
144      }
145
146      return true;
147   }
148
149   private static boolean isArgumentAssignable(Class<?> paramType, Class<?> argType) {
150      if (argType == null) {
151         return !paramType.isPrimitive();
152      }
153      return paramType.isAssignableFrom(argType);
154   }
155
156}
